Description:
Renovated Delight!
In a popular strip of Kennington on a great sized block, sits this charming home. Only minutes from Strath Village, Kennington and St. Therese's Primary School, Kennington reservoir, parks, ovals and quick trip into the centre of town, this property is in an ideal location. With a recently renovated interior and lovely yard, this house is one that would suit all.
Inside, the open and spacious living area becomes the centre of the home. Large open windows fill the area with natural light and beautiful timber floorboards line the floor. The remodelled kitchen, a year old, is complete with great bench and cupboard space, a Smeg oven with gas cooktop with pull out teppanyaki addition, built in wine rack, soft close doors and drawers and a pull out nikpol corner solution.
The generous sized master bedroom is complete with built in wardrobes and overlooks the lovely yard. Bedrooms 2 and 3 are also of good size and both feature built in wardrobes. Inside the family bathroom you will find a bath, shower and sink with vanity.
The laundry is a good size with bench and cupboard space, rear access and all the room needed for the washer and dryer. The home is comfortable all year round with refrigerated cooling and ducting heating throughout. The hallway and all three bedrooms have also recently had new carpet and underlay added.
Outside is a great feature of this home. Perfectly set up as a man cave and a workshop is the large powered shed. Relax, entertain and work in this area with a free standing wood fire, plenty of bench and cupboard space for all the tools and Foxtel for the TV.
Entertain your guests in style and ease on the beautiful timber deck. Fully fenced and overlooking the yard with easy access to inside, it is a great spot to entertain. Decorating the grassed area are lovely shrubs, hedges, flowers and trees.
The home is fully fenced and secure, has a three car garage and has a great front yard that is fenced.
If a recently renovated home with a great interior and lovely yard is what you desire, then look no further than this modern delight.

Description:
Outstanding Investment or Home in Prime Position
Neatly presented inside and out, and offering exceptional value in this highly regarded position, is this comfortable residence, situated only 1km from Strath Village Shopping Centre, and Kennington Reservoir.
- Floorplan comprises 3 spacious bedrooms with built in robes, an open plan kitchen/meals and living space, updated bathroom, and two toilets.
- Undercover outdoor living overlooking the large back yard (allotment size 665m2) which is secure for pets/children, and offers vehicle access, through to the single garage/workshop.
- Further attributes include polished timber floorboards, beautiful pressed tin ceiling in the living area, and split system heating/cooling to provide year round comfort.
- Currently rented to exceptional tenants, returning $280 per week.
Perfect property for a variety of buyers, who will be attracted to the minimal distance to La Trobe University, popular primary and secondary schooling, shopping, gym, and other recreational facilities.
Bendigo CBD is also only 2.2km away.
Make this your new home or add it to your investment portfolio.

Description:
SO NEAT, SO AFFORDABLE!
A fantastic opportunity presents to purchase this affordable, neat as a pin home located a short walk to La Trobe University and popular Strath & Kennington Village shopping centres. In excellent order throughout, the home is ready for the purchaser to live or lease immediately. A very comfortable home to occupy, the choice is easy to live as is for now until you are ready to unleash the properties full potential in the years to come. Or for the investor, the top shelf location means you will be primed to take advantage and choose from a plethora of applicants in time for the 2018 University year.
The existing weatherboard home has protective cladding, providing a clean modern look. The home has recently seen a fresh lick of paint throughout, and some new carpets installed in the living area. Parts of the internal layout have been updated, whilst others remain in their original state and in extremely good order, leaving the choice up to you as to renovate or not. The floor plan consists of three carpeted bedrooms (two with built in robes) all with ceiling fans, central light filled lounge with feature gas log fire and split system unit, separate kitchen/dining area with French doors to alfresco area, basic but extremely functional kitchen with gas cooking, three piece bathroom and a laundry/toilet area at the rear. Attractive hardwood flooring flows throughout the high traffic areas.
The home sits elevated on a tick under 650m2 (approx) allotment that is secure and private away from the main road. There is plenty of lawn area, whilst a sunny alfresco area is great for the nicer weather. There is plenty of off street parking available, whilst lockable double gates offer vehicle access to the rear where there is a good sized shed with concrete and hot water, power is not currently connected to the shed, however all lights and power points are available.
Nest or invest now while opportunities like this one are still affordable and future potential can be unleashed! Such a great location with an affordable price tag will suit investors, first home buyers, or a retired couple to name but a few. Plan your future today and call for an inspection!

Description:
MID-CENTURY MODERN MASTERPIECE
Tucked away in a quiet street in the coveted McIvor Hill locale handy to schools, supermarket, transport and sporting facilities, this property is the perfect package of position, personality and mid-century modern panache.
Understated from the street but with lots of interior style, it was designed by highly regarded architects, Whitford and Peck in the late 60's. A far cry from the more traditional brown brick veneer homes of the era, it exhibits modernist style features such as clean, simple lines with no excess detailing, floor to ceiling windows, polished timber floors and a relaxed indoor outdoor aesthetic.nOne of the most striking features is the use of natural light throughout, with every room overlooking gardens, courtyards or patios.
An ideal home for entertaining, it has spacious lounge and dining rooms with a separate sitting room or library with a wall of bookshelves and open fireplace creating the perfect space for coffee or a port after dinner.
A new galley-style kitchen boasts the best in appliances and walk-in pantry with a dinette at the end and sliding doors to a relaxing courtyard with light-filtering wisteria vine overhead and a stacked stone wall for privacy.
Internal temperature control is taken care of by new gas ducted heating and split system units.
All three bedrooms feature extensive fitted robes while the large master suite is located away from the action and overlooks the rear patio while all-new bathroom includes bath, walk-in shower and vanity with a new laundry and second WC alongside.
Storage space is premium throughout; linen cupboards line the hallway and a brick-lined under-house store room makes the perfect wine cellar to keep the reds in mint condition for that special dinner party while hiding bulky items like suitcases and sports gear.
The landscaped allotment approximately 1,136 m² is like a private sanctuary where brick paths wind between stone edged-garden beds under shady trees with room for a pool if desired.
This unique home is solid, immaculately presented and retains its "in vogue" mid-century modern styling

Description:
Across The Road From LaTrobe
Set at the rear of the 2,252sqm allotment, this unassuming 1970s residence is in exceptional original condition with features ahead of its time and perfectly positioned to further subdivide the land (S.T.C.A).
- 3 spacious bedrooms, 2 bathrooms including corner spa.
- Generous lounge opens onto full length front veranda overlooking the pool and established gardens.
- Timber kitchen adjoins dinning room with built in bar.
- Loads of internal storage, double carport and workshop.
Feasibility costings available for a 2 lot subdivision, or enjoy the space and privacy of being on over half an acre within close walking distance to Bendigo South East College and Strathdale shopping precinct.

Description:
INVESTOR ALERT! SET & FORGET INVESTMENT!
A superb investment opportunity for the astute investor to purchase these two 1-bedroom units.
One title – sold as a pair
In a top location, right across the road from Harry Trott Oval, 2-minute drive to the CBD of Bendigo, Coles Supermarket and within walking distance to local schools, Bendigo train station and bus stop. La Trobe Uni is only a 5-minute drive away.
Both have a kitchen & lounge at the front, separate bathroom, laundry, toilet with bedroom at the rear.
THE DETAILS:
Unit 6 - Vacant.
Completely refurbished with updated kitchen & bathroom, new carpets, fresh paint, new window furnishings.
Gas stove, gas heating & air conditioner, single carport.
Possible rental return of $170 - $190pw
Unit 7 - Occupied
In very good order throughout with an excellent long-term tenant for over 20 years wanting to stay.
Vinyl plank flooring in the kitchen & bathroom, carpeted lounge & bedroom.
1 car space.
Currently returning $155pw
Perfect addition to your investment portfolio or live in unit 6 while you rent out unit 7.
Call today to arrange an inspection.

Description:
Position, Position, Position
Located just 400 metres from the Bendigo CBD, the Market Place Shopping Centre and just a couple of minutes drive to Latrobe University and some great schools. This immaculately presented home is positioned perfectly in a quiet and beautiful tree lined street. Set on its own title, the home comprises three bedrooms all with built in robes. The large family bathroom is centrally located and includes a separate shower and bath. The well equipped kitchen boasts gas appliances, a good size pantry and overlooks the naturally lit dining area and leads you through a sliding door to a 10m x 2m undercover entertaining area. Your comfort is well assured all year round with central evaporative air conditioning throughout plus a gas wall furnace with a rear vent to guide the heat through the home. Externally the property features a single lock up garage with power, concrete floor and roller door plus side access door, and a well built single carport. Wonderful established landscaped gardens and at the front you have a large grassed area. An added bonus is double gated access to the side of the house, suitable for a caravan, boat or trailer. Ideally suited to the first home buyer, investor, or those looking to live on the CBD doorstep, with walking distance to work or you could travel the close by public transport (from Miller Street and again Williamson Street). This one will not last long, call today to arrange your private inspection.

Description:
Subdivision Potential Set on a huge 1631sqm allotment!
Set in the heart of Kennington this property offers ample opportunities for investors, developers or even a first home owner. This property proposes subdivision potential (STCA) for two 3 bedroom, 2 bathroom, 2 garage townhouses in an ideal location only seconds to all amenities and walking distance to the La Trobe University!
The existing dwelling represents terrific value and consists up to three bedrooms and a spacious kitchen with separate bathroom. Why not subdivide, sell and develop the rear? Or, for an immediate return you could rent out the existing dwelling while developing the rear. With an abundance of options this versatile property is a fantastic choice! The existing dwelling offers expected returns of up to $270 per week.
This central location is hard to come by and opportunities in this part of town rarely arise. Set walking distance to the Kennington Village shopping complex, transportation and Flora Hill amenities. The Bendigo CBD is also located just a short walk/drive, along with local schools and childcare facilities. Dont delay contacting the agent today for your inspection! This property will not last!

Description:
TRANQUIL KENNINGTON LOCATION CLOSE TO UNIVERSITY
Spacious brick-veneer unit situated at the end of a quiet court in a prime Kennington position is the ideal investor package,first home or retiree nest.
Ready for new owners to add their own personal touch with a cosmetic upgrade, it features two bedrooms, main with built-in robe, large lounge with big north-facing windows, split system heating/cooling and high cathedral ceilings with exposed beams adding to the sense of space. The kitchen is kitted out with electric cooking, dishwasher, pantry and built-in table. The three-piece bathroom is centrally located while the laundry includes storage and external access to the very private, paved rear yard with undercover parking for one vehicle and garden shed.
With just two units on the block and no body corporate to worry about, this affordably priced and perfectly located property is an easy walk to everything – shopping, LaTrobe University, doctors, sporting facilities, Kennington Reservoir, walking tracks and public transport.

Description:
Luxury home close to university and shops
Located in one of the prestige estates of Kennington within an easy walk of Latrobe University, shopping centres and only but a short drive to other popular schooling facilities, is this immaculately presented home.
Set high in a small court with views over the estate, it offers total privacy from other neighbouring homes. It features an enormous open living plan with a lovely northerly aspect, looking over a well-manicured garden, the block size being a little over 800m2. The home accommodates 3 extra-large bedrooms with the main offering a walk-through dressing robe to a full ensuite, while the other two bedrooms have large 2-door sliding robes with ample storage.
A double garage with remote doors features direct entry to the residence, where a study nook is located close to the front entry, with views over the front garden and driveway.
In the centre of the home is a well-appointed kitchen with wall oven, hot plates and dishwasher, plus ample benches and cupboards. The well-designed main bathroom includes shower, bath and vanity, and allows a separate powder room area option for convenience.
The home features ducted heating and cooling systems and higher ceilings that give you a sense of grandeur. Outside has a large paved entertainment area adjoining the living room, which offers a private area to sit and enjoy the garden setting.
Homes in this popular estate rarely come on to the market and are highly sought after. Arrange your inspection today to avoid disappointment.

Description:
Charming Home in Sought After Location
Set on a 684m2 (approx) allotment, is this appealing property which will suit a multitude of buyers including young families, first home owners & investors alike. The spacious lounge features a gas heater & mantle as well as a wall air condiitoner, although the recent addition of ducted heating & evaporative cooling maintains temperature control throughout the whole house. There are three bedrooms, the main with a ceiling fan & a separate multi-purpose area currently used as a formal dining room. The bathroom includes a shower, bath & vanity with two way access to the toilet from both the bathroom & laundry. The kitchen contains good bench & cupboard options as well as extra space for a second dining table. Step outside to the fantastic undercover verandah & the spacious backyard which offers plenty of room for kids & pets to play. An oversized single garage & secure fencing complete this affordable home, in close proximity to St Therese's & Kennington Primary Schools, Bendigo South East College, Latrobe University, shopping centres, public transport & central Bendigo.

Description:
Fabulous waterfront home with scenic views - highly regarded locale
- Very impressive three bedroom home (Built 1990), master with ensuite and walk in robe
- Outstanding designed light filled home built by quality builder Simon Cusack
- Separate Lounge with water views of the beautiful tranquil Kennington reservoir
- Spacious master bedroom with balcony overlooking the natureland and birdlife of the reservoir
- Ducted gas heating and evaporative cooling for all seasons. Double garage with internal access
- Central modern kitchen integrates with internal entertainment areas
- Close to Kennington village, Strathhaven, public transport and all amenities
- Unique home conveniently located near walking tracks, wetlands and parklands
An amazing designed home in one of'the best locations in Kennington/Strathdale. A rare opportunity to secure a quality home with waterfront views in Bendigo. This truly stunning home is light filled with great views of the beautiful reservoir opposite from several vantage points within the home. Simply relax on the balcony or inside to enjoy the peace and tranquility that this wonderful home offers to its future owners. You'll love it and all the home has to offer.

Description:
Charm & Character In The Ever Popular Kennington
You'll love the location of this charming California Bungalow home - a short walk to the centre of town and 100 metres from Kennington Recreation Reserve and the Harry Trott Oval. Popular schools - St Therese's, Kennington Primary and Bendigo South East - are close by. Beautiful stained glass windows, polished hardwood floors and ceiling roses in the bedrooms are just some of the original features of this much loved home. The well designed kitchen would suit the keen cook, with Miele appliances and ample storage, including a walk in pantry. The dining area and living space have sliding double glazed floor to ceiling windows which open out to a vine covered deck overlooking the garden.
The large backyard has established fruit trees and two water tanks. There is a garage and another fully lined shed. This is a home you can just move into and enjoy but there's also scope for the new owners to add their own personal touches or even to expand the house.

Description:
Central Art Deco on large block
This recently renovated and freshly painted early 1960s three bedroom, two living room property includes pre-approval for a two lot subdivision. The existing home is a stunning example of the red brick and cream stucco art deco style with its curved porch, tiled roof, three panel metal framed windows, detailed plaster work, stained hardwood floors, timber door frames, internal doors with bakelite handles and high timber skirts.
The entrance with elegant chandelier leads to the master bedroom with his and hers built in robes to the right and set of frosted glass and timber doors to the left that open into the formal living with striking geometric ceiling rose, beautiful gold and green art deco pendant and timber mantel with feature brick fireplace. A second set of internal doors lead into the separate dining room with matching fireplace, deco pendant and working fireplace for intimate evenings dining in.
The cream and grey U-shaped kitchen was installed only five years ago and features floor to ceiling cabinetry with two double door pantries, stone look bench tops, double sink and stainless steel appliances including gas cooktop and electric wall oven as well as enough space for the traditional kitchen table.
The L shaped central hallway with linen press leads to the property’s two remaining double bedrooms as well as the recently renovated crisp white and timber laundry and stunning matching bathroom with high gloss cabinetry, shower, toilet, free standing oval bath and vanity with round above mount hand basin, round mirror and striking black fixtures and fittings. The largest of these bedrooms includes a complete wall of elegant floor to ceiling black cabinetry and walk in storage in the third.
A modern external powder room with toilet and hand basin is accessible from the rear covered porch opposite the kitchen – ideally positioned for guests when entertaining in the shady rear garden.
Additional features include:
- Gas heater & split system heating & cooling (main living)
- Solid fuel heating in formal dining
- Off street parking for up to two cars
- Hand rails to front and rear entries with a ramp leading to the rear yard
- Single gate side access to fully fenced rear garden with vegetable bed and poultry house
- Mature established shade trees and plants including roses, fig tree, azaleas, hydrangeas, grapevine and Japanese maple
- Garden shed with concrete floor, power and sprinkler system control
- Three room bungalow in original condition with bathroom/laundry, living/kitchenette & bedroom (would require renovation & reconnection of services)
Within walking distance of the Bendigo CBD and Coles Bendigo East this inner-city property provides a unique opportunity for investors looking for preapproved subdivision potential or excellent rental returns from short or long stay accommodation as well as first home buyers or downsizers looking to value add.

Description:
SUPERB READY MADE HOME
Established pre-loved perfection in a quiet sought after locale, this fabulous BV home will be the definitive end of your search! A stones throw from La Trobe University and other major amenities including Kennington & Strath Village shopping complexes, and the popular Kennington Lake, this property will suit a range of quality home seekers including families, retirees and investors alike!
Solid as a rock and in immaculate order throughout, credit must go the previous owners for maintaining the property to an impeccable standard. The floor plan is flexible and spacious, and remains in superb condition with some recent renovations a bonus for the new owner. Boasting four good sized bedrooms, all with built in robes and the master suite featuring walk in robe and ensuite. The main bathroom and laundry are located in the rear wing of the home, whilst a separate study (or fifth bedroom) lies off the entrance at the front. Attractive timber floors flow through most of the home, whilst ducted cooling and gas heating take care of the temperature. Ticking an important box are the two separate living spaces – the first is the spacious lounge with feature brick wall and gas log fire, the second forming part of the open plan kitchen meals and living area. The brand new modern kitchen is a gift to the lucky purchaser, and includes new 900mm oven and cooktop, dishwasher and all new cabinetry and benches as well as walk in pantry and lovely breakfast bar.
Outside, the sizable 1180m2 (approx.) allotment has been beautifully landscaped with lovely gardens, lawn and paths meaning most of the hard work has been done for you. If you enjoy dining or entertaining outdoors, the enormous covered entertaining area will absolutely delight! With a built in bbq and enough room for a large gathering in any weather, it will also double as an extra carport for a caravan or trailer! A double garage lies at the front, with plenty of room for off street caravan storage as well. A clever conversion of an concrete water tank takes care of shedding.
An absolute gem that is ready to live in and love immediately, with vacant possession available now. In a top position in a terrific neighbourhood, come and see for yourself and you will be suitably impressed!

Description:
WINNING POSITION WITH HUGE POTENTIAL
Post-war weatherboard home in a quiet, tightly-held Kennington street is in sound original condition. The ideal first home or investment property has two bedrooms, both with built-in robes and ceiling fans, spacious gas-heated lounge, compact bathroom, separate laundry/wc and kitchen equipped with gas stove, original cabinetry and room for dining.
Set on a block approximately 720 square metres with a big backyard including carport and garden shed with Timbertop Drive playground over the back fence.
The property has a solid rental history with an excellent tenant currently in place while the plum position is within easy walking distance to public and private primary schools, Bendigo South East College, LaTrobe University, Strath Village/Kennington shopping centres and public transport.
This is a place with great future potential - live in, let out or land bank for further development – every which way this one is a winner!

CLOSE TO THE HEART....

- Kitchen with gas cooking/separate dining room.
- Bathroom with shower over bath, gas heating, r/c split system.
- Timber alfresco entertaining deck, single lock up garage.
Perfect for first home buyers and investors alike available with vacant possession.
